TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DynamicRenderer extends System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn

Docs.summary: Draws ink on a surface as the user moves the tablet pen.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The class inherits from the class, and allows ink to be rendered to a surface as the user moves the mouse pointer with a tablet pen or other pointing device. You can use the to dynamically render ink on a custom control, or inherit from to perform custom rendering in real time on an ink-enabled element, such as the . Dynamic rendering is done on a thread separate from the application's user interface thread when the user inputs ink with a tablet pen. When a mouse is used, dynamic rendering is done on the UI thread. > [!NOTE] > In order to reference this class as a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] element, you must map the CLR namespace to a prefix, and use that prefix to qualify the element. For details, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-namespaces-and-namespace-mapping-for-wpf-xaml). ## XAML Text Usage This class is not typically used in XAML. ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to attach a to an . To create a control that dynamically renders ink, see [Creating an Ink Input Control](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/creating-an-ink-input-control). [!code-csharp[StylusPluginSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/CSharp/StylusControl.cs#3)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/VisualBasic/StylusControl.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Reset (System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice stylusDevice, System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection stylusPoints);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Reset(class System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice stylusDevice, class System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection stylusPoints) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub Reset (stylusDevice As StylusDevice, stylusPoints As StylusPointCollection)

abstract member Reset : System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice * System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection -> unit override this.Reset : System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice * System.Windows.Input.StylusPointCollection -> unit

Docs.param: The stylus points to be redrawn.
Docs.summary: Clears rendering on the current stroke and redraws it.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer> redraws the current stroke and any of the stylus points passed into the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer.Reset%2A> method. This method allows you to redraw a stroke while the user is still creating the stroke. The tablet pen must be touching the digitizer or the left mouse button must be pressed when <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer.Reset%2A> is called.
## Examples The following example changes the color of the current stroke as it is being drawn.
[!code-csharp[StylusPluginSamples#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/CSharp/StylusControl.cs#13)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/VisualBasic/StylusControl.vb#13)]

Docs.exception: Neither the stylus nor the mouse is in the down state.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RootVisual As Visual
public: property System::Windows::Media::Visual ^ RootVisual { System::Windows::Media::Visual ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the root visual for the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you use a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer>, you must attach the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer.RootVisual%2A> property to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter.AttachVisuals%2A> method.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer> and add the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer.RootVisual%2A> to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkPresenter>. To create a control that dynamically renders ink, see [Creating an Ink Input Control](/dotnet/framework/wpf/advanced/creating-an-ink-input-control).
[!code-csharp[StylusPluginSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/CSharp/StylusControl.cs#3)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/StylusPluginSamples/VisualBasic/StylusControl.vb#3)]
